CookieChangeEvent.summary: The CookieChangeEvent interface of the {{domxref("Cookie Store API", "", "", "nocode")}} is the event type of the event fired at a when any cookies are created or deleted.

blockquote.para: A cookie that is replaced due to the insertion of another cookie with the same name, domain, and path, is ignored and does not trigger a change event.

CookieChangeEventChanged.summary: The changed read-only property of the interface returns an array of the cookies that have been changed.

remarks.para: Note that this will exclude cookies which were created with an expiry date in the past, as these cookies are immediately deleted.

CookieChangeEventChanged.value: An array of objects containing the changed cookie(s). Each object contains the following properties:

CookieChangeEventCookieChangeEvent.summary:
The CookieChangeEvent() constructor creates a new object
which is the event type of the event fired at a when any cookie changes occur.
This constructor is called by the browser when a change event occurs.

blockquote.para: This event constructor is generally not needed for production websites. It's primary use is for tests that require an instance of this event.

CookieChangeEventDeleted.summary: The deleted read-only property of the interface returns an array of the cookies that have been deleted by the given CookieChangeEvent instance.

remarks.para: Note that this will include cookies which were created with an expiry date in the past, as these cookies are immediately deleted.

CookieChangeEventDeleted.value: An array of objects containing the deleted cookie(s). Each object contains the following properties:
